itemType.name: Emblem
entries: You can only be attuned to one emblem at a time

itemType.name: Enhancement
entries: An item enhanced by Arcanuminium is considered magical if it was not already. An Enhancement can be added to, removed from or swapped with another Enhancement over the course of a long rest. An item can only have one enhancement at a time, unless it or the item has a feature that allows otherwise.

shop.name: Fragment N-001
entries: {@i This one is far older than any enhancement you’ve seen before…}
This enhancement can be fused to any non magical weapon. While fused to a weapon, you gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls made with said weapon.
This enhancement can be fused alongside another enhancement, so long as it is of a rarity equal to or lower than this enhancement.

shop.name: Wrath Emblem
entries: Even looking at this makes your head fill with thoughts of violence

While attuned to this item and bloodied, your critical hit range increases by 2 (if you would score a critical hit on a natural 20, you can now score it on an 18 or higher, if you would score a critical hit on a 19 or higher, you instead score one on a 17 or higher)

shop.name: Overloaded Lens
entries: This is a circular crystal lens encased in iron. It brightens any light shone through it significantly, but it feels almost uncomfortably hot when you do so.

While attuned, when you impose an instantaneous AOE effect that deals damage originating from you, you can convert it to a line. (with both cones and radii originating from you, it becomes double the length and 5ft wide).

While attuned, whenever you impose an instantaneous AOE line originating from you and multiple creatures are in the line, you can overload the effect: the first creature in the line takes two more die of damage. Whenever you overload, take {@dice 1d4}+PROF radiant damage that can't be reduced or ignored.

shop.name: Gravebound Conduit
entries: This bundle of black strings seems unusually suited to transmitting deathly energies.
While attuned to this item, you can use the Wrack Foes ability more than once per turn. Additionally, you may reroll ones once on your Wrack Foes damage.

shop.name: Fragment N-007
entries: {@i Inscribed into the fragment is the phrase “out of spells, not options”}

This enhancement can be fused to any spellcasting focus or weapon. While fused to an item, it becomes a spellcasting focus, if it isn’t already. You gain a +1 bonus to the spell attack rolls and spell save DC of spells cast through this item.

shop.name: Fragment S-196
entries: {@i Sticky… metal?}

This enhancement can be fused to any shield. When you attempt to grapple a creature, you can consider the fused shield as a free hand for the purposes of grappling. While grappling a creature this way, any magical properties (outside of curses) of the shield are suppressed for the duration of the grapple. Once you have successfully grappled a creature this way, you must finish a short rest before you can do so again.

shop.name: Fragment Z-560
entries: {@i “Teleporting has never been so easy with the Go Further 9000TM!”}

This enhancement can be fused to any armour or clothing. While wearing the infused item, the range of your teleportation spells and features is increased by an amount equal to (5 x Proficiency Bonus) feet.

shop.name: Fragment O-478
entries: {@i This metal is shockingly cold to the touch.}

This enhancement can be fused to any metal armour, shield or weapon. While wielding or wearing the fused item, if an item you or an ally within 30ft is wearing or wielding is targeted by the Heat Metal spell or a similar effect, the target of the spell is changed to this item instead. You do not suffer any downsides from the spell/effect outside of the damage.

shop.name: Fragment X-431
entries: {@i Caution: Explosive}
This enhancement can be fused to any non magical melee weapon. While fused to a weapon, it gains the Exploding property

shop.name: Flickering Rune
entries: This rune can be attached to any non-magical weapon, causing it to become flickering. A flickering rune causes a weapon to shimmer, grow blurry and indistinct, and momentarily turn invisible at random intervals for a second or two. Creatures have disadvantage on attempts they make to disarm you of a flickering weapon and you have advantage on attempts to avoid being disarmed. On a critical hit with a flickering weapon, the target must make a DC (8+prof+Strength or Dexterity) constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of your next turn.

shop.name: Fragment N-010
entries: {@i A fragment fit for a master of battle!}
This enhancement can be fused to any non-magical weapon or armour. While fused to an item, your non-spell save DCs increase by one. This is considered a +1 for the purposes of +1 stacking rules.

shop.name: Granite Blade
entries: Due to the sheer weight of this weapon, you can swing yourself around with it. As part of making an attack with this weapon, you can move up to 5ft towards your target without provoking opportunity attacks. This cannot be used to make lateral movement around a target, and can only be used if the 5ft of movement actually brings the user within reach of the target.

shop.name: Coinhammer
entries: Whenever you successfully hit with this weapon, instead of rolling damage you flip a number of coins equal to twice your proficiency bonus. (For digital use, roll a 1d2 and treat a 2 as a success, with this feature being unaffected by any reroll or dice modifying features.)

For each successful flip, this weapon deals 3 magical bludgeoning damage for that hit. the user takes magical bludgeoning damage equal to two times the amount of lost flips. This damage can be reduced, but cannot be ignored. Dealing critical damage with this weapon means flipping twice as many coins.
If you win every flip, you may flip another set of coins: these coins deal 6 damage either direction.

{@i [Author's note to user:  The weapon always still deals additional damage equal to your strength like a normal maul - the coins only replace the d12 you would normally roll. For example, winning 4 out of 6 flips deals 12+STR damage to your opponent while taking 4 damage in return. Additionally, The win-big set of coins cannot retrigger itself. If you DO manage to succeed on all your win-big flips, send me a screenshot so I can laugh at it forever]}
{@i [Author’s 2nd note: the coins cannot be rerolled by reroll features]}

shop.name: Grinning Gastronome
entries: {@i This giant curved blade seems to have a hinge in the middle, with the inner edge lined with... teeth?}
At the start of your turn, you may choose to have this weapon folded or unfolded.

Folded: This weapon deals 1d10 slashing damage, and you can as a reaction to being successfully hit with a ranged attack attempt to "eat" said incoming ranged attack with your blade. Reduce the damage by 1d10+Proficiency bonus - if this fully reduces the damage, you feel pretty cool.
Unfolded: This weapon deals 2d6 bludgeoning damage and has reach.

shop.name: Red Iron Focus
entries: {@i This engraved disc of red iron is covered in tiny symbols. It feels like it... needs an exchange, in order to imbue its user with power.}
This item can be used as a spellcasting foci by any spellcasting class.
When attuning to this item and at the end of a long rest, choose Strength or Guile.
Strength: You cannot be involuntarily moved, and add 1d4 to strength and constitution saving throws. You subtract 1d4 from wisdom saving throws.
Guile: You have advantage against being charmed or frightened, and add 1d4 to a mental saving throw of your choice (chosen at start of session). Your Maximum HP is reduced by 13.
You may only have one of these bonuses active at a time.

shop.name: The Quetzal
entries: {@i A thin bow made from bone carved from the walls - the “joints” allow for a much longer draw. It seems to have a faint heartbeat under your hand.}

Once per turn while wielding this weapon, you can choose to roll an attack with this weapon at disadvantage (this disadvantage cannot be negated, mitigated or cancelled by any other effect, including advantage.) If you successfully hit with this attack, you use 4d3 as your damage die for that attack and knock the target up to 10ft backwards.

magicvariant.name: Underwood Armour

entries: While you are bloodied (at half of your remaining hit points or lower) you gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed. Additionally, this armour weighs half as much as its metal counterpart, and allows you to swim in heavy armour as if it was medium and medium armour as if it was light.

While you are bloodied (at half of your remaining hit points or lower) you gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed. Additionally, this armour weighs half as much as its metal counterpart, and allows you to swim in heavy armour as if it was medium and medium armour as if it was light.

magicvariant.name: Marocrunch Mandible
entries: This repurposed mandible still carries some of the strength to crunch through bone.

Upon landing a critical hit with this weapon, the target takes 2d4 extra bludgeoning damage (this does not get doubled by said crit) and has their movement halved until the end of your next turn. This movement reduction cannot stack with other similar effects.
